objects.name: Attack Flow
objects.description: Extends STIX 2.1 with features to create Attack Flows.

external_references.description: Source code repository for Attack Flow

objects.name: Black Basta Ransomware
objects.description: Black Basta is a RaaS (Ransomware as a Service), written in C++, that has been in development since February 2022 and in active use since April 2022. Operators using Black Basta employ a double-extortion technique where they encrypt files on the target systems and demand payment for the decryption key while also threatening to leak the information if they are not paid.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Attachment
objects.description: Victims receive spear phishing emails with  malicious zip files attached.

objects.name: User Execution: Malicious File
objects.description: The zip files are extracted and usually contain a malicious document, such as a .doc, .pdf, or .xls.

objects.name: System Services: Service Execution
objects.description: Black Basta installs and uses PsExec to execute payloads on remote hosts.

objects.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
objects.description: Invoke-TotalExec is used to push out the ransomware binary.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: PowerShell
objects.description: Within the malicious files, encoded PowerShell scripts are used to download additional malicious scripts.

objects.name: PsExec
objects.description: run processes remotely using any user's credentials

objects.name: Create Account
objects.description: Accounts are created with names such as temp, r, or admin.

objects.name: Account Manipulation
objects.description: The new accounts are added to the administrator's group to maintain elevated access.

objects.name: Create or Modify System Process: Windows Service
objects.description: Benign-looking services are created for the ransomware binary.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Search Order Hijacking
objects.description: Black Basta uses Qakbot DLL files, which can exploit the Windows 7 calculator to execute malicious payloads.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Visual Basic
objects.description: The extracted files contain malicious macros.

objects.name: Domain Policy Modification: Group Policy Modification
objects.description: The Group Policy is modified for privilege escalation and defense evasion.

objects.name: System Binary Proxy Execution: Regsvr32
objects.description: regsvr32.exe is used to execute a malicious DLL

objects.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: BlackBasta attempts to delete malicious batch files.

objects.name: Modify Registry
objects.description: Modifications are made to the Registry.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Due to password protection, the zip files are able to bypass some AV detections.

objects.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools
objects.description: BlackBasta disables Windows Defender with batch scripts, such as d.bat or defof.bat.

objects.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify System Firewall
objects.description: Batch scripts, such as rdp.bat or SERVI.bat, are used to modify the firewall to allow remote administration and RDP.

objects.name: Impair Defenses: Safe Mode Boot
objects.description: BlackBasta uses bcdedit to boot the device in safe mode.

objects.name: Debugger Evasion
objects.description: IsDebuggerPresent is used to check if processes are being debugged.

objects.name: Credentials from Password Stores
objects.description: Mimkatz is used to dump passwords.

objects.name: Mimikatz
objects.description: This tool allows users to extract passwords and credentials.

objects.name: Account Discovery: Domain Account
objects.description: Commands are used to discover domain account information.

objects.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
objects.description: Attackers discovered internal IP addresses typically found on the domain controller.

objects.name: System Information Discovery
objects.description: GetComputerName is used to query to the computer name

objects.name: Remote Services: Remote Desktop Protocol
objects.description: RDP used for lateral movement.

objects.name: Archive Collected Data: Archive via Utility
objects.description: BlackBasta collects data from infected systems.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over Web Service
objects.description: BlackBasta exfiltrates data from the network prior to encrypting files.

objects.name: Remote Access Software
objects.description: Legitimate tools, such as TeamViewer and AnyConnect, are installed and used on targeted systems.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel
objects.description: Cobalt Strike is used for command-and-control communications.

objects.name: Cobalt Strike
objects.description: threat emulation program

objects.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
objects.description: Files (except .exe, .cmd, .bat, and .com) on the system are encrypted using ChaCha20 or RSA-4096, and their extension is changed to .basta.

objects.name: Modify Registry
objects.description: Registry key HKCU\Control Panel\Desktop is created and a .jpg file is add to change the icon of encrypted files.

objects.name: Service Stop
objects.description: sc stop and taskkill is used to stop services.

objects.name: Inhibit System Recovery
objects.description: BlackBasta deletes volume shadow copies using vssadmin.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel
objects.description: Qakbot is used for command-and-control communications

objects.name: Qakbot
objects.description: aka Qbot; Windows malware strain that has evolved into a malware dropper

objects.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
objects.description: Cobalt Strike is deployed on the targeted system.

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: Once booted in safe mode, BlackBasta will iterate through the entire file system

objects.name: vssadmin.exe
objects.description: A command-line tool that manages Volume Shadow Copy Service (VSS), which captures and copies stable images for backups on running systems.

objects.name: Internal Defacement
objects.description: The files <random-letters>.ico and <random-letters>.jpg are written to the %TEMP% directory. The .jpg file is leveraged to overwrite the desktop background and appears as follows: "Your network is encrypted by the Black Basta group. Instructions in the file readme.txt"

objects.name: Financial Theft
objects.description: BlackBasta leverages double extortion as part of its attacks. The group not only executes ransomware and demands money to decrypt the files, but they also exfiltrate sensitive data and threaten to release that data publicly if their demands are not met.

objects.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion
objects.description: The ransomware includes anti-analysis techniques that attempt to detect code emulation or sandboxing to avoid virtual/analysis machine environments.

objects.name: User Credentials
objects.description: User credentials are obtained from credential dumping.
